channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Legal experts condemn Apple bowing to White House's request to remove ICE tracking app
item.description: It's the latest example of tech giants bowing to pressure from the Trump administration. Legal experts say the developer of the app has free speech ri...

item.title: We need hospitals more than football stadiums, say Morocco's young protesters
item.description: Morocco will soon have the world's largest football stadium but this has angered many young people who want better services.

item.title: 10/3: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on the sentencing of Sean "Diddy" Combs, Hamas partially accepting a peace deal outlined by President Trump, and more.

item.title: Suspected drones force second Munich airport closure in 24 hours
item.description: Flights were suspended at 21:30 local time, with around 6,500 passengers affected.

item.title: 10/3: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: White House eyes mass layoffs amid stalled government funding. Also, Taylor Swift drops new album, “The Life of a Showgirl."

item.title: 'Machines don't see gender': India's first female train driver on blazing the trail
item.description: Surekha Yadav became a train driver at a time when it was uncommon for Indian women to take up the profession.

item.title: 10/3: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: Behind the judge's reasoning for Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing; Reporter's Notebook: Trump rebrands words as tools of power.

item.title: They're making sex jokes in Saudi: Inside the controversial comedy festival
item.description: A-listers including Dave Chappelle, Bill Burr and Jack Whitehall have faced a backlash over the event.

item.title: 10/3: CBS Evening News
item.description: Everything we know about Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing on prostitution-related charges; Pudge the cat steals the show at Bowling Green football games...

item.title: Money paid but no ship: The around-the-world cruise that is yet to set sail
item.description: The BBC has been speaking to retirees who want the firm selling the cruise to stop advertising and refund their deposits.

item.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs sentenced to over 4 years for prostitution-related charges
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs' sentencing hearing was held three months after he was convicted ​on two prostitution-related charges.

item.title: Denmark prepares for a Russian 'hybrid war' after repeated drone spottings
item.description: Many Danes are rethinking their personal security, and stocking up on emergency supplies, amid unidentified drone appearances. Denmark's leaders warn ...

item.title: Hamas says it accepts some elements of Gaza peace plan after Trump issues ultimatum
item.description: Hamas said it has accepted some elements of President Trump's plan, including giving up power and releasing all remaining hostages, but that others re...

item.title: Sean Combs sentenced to over four years in prison for prostitution-related charges
item.description: Combs had been convicted in July on two counts of transportation for prostitution. During his sentencing hearing he spoke at length for the first time...

item.title: Shutdown has already delayed the jobs report. More critical reports could be held up
item.description: The government's monthly jobs report was not published Friday as a result of the federal shutdown. That's left businesses and policymakers in the dark...

item.title: Trump pauses $2.1B for Chicago infrastructure projects, leveraging shutdown to pressure Democrats
Government funding vote fails again in Senate as hopes fade for quick end to shutdown
item.description: Hopes for a quick end to the government shutdown are fading. Democrats have refused to budge in a Senate vote.

item.title: The only protester still locked up after Trump’s campus crackdown breaks silence: ‘I feel helpless’
